body_html:
I've also observed a clear disparity in the time taken by the first invocation of x.cuda() on Linux x64 with pytorch 0.1.12 and python 2.7.11 on a Titan X (Pascal); I've confirmed that I have the cu80 version of the conda package installed:

conda search pytorch -c soumith|egrep "0.1.12.*py27_2.*cuda80"
                  *  0.1.12               py27_2cu80  soumith         [cuda80]

For 0.1.12, the first invocation takes about 10 seconds for a 100x100 FloatTensor, while for 0.1.10, the first invocation takes about 2 seconds for the same.

body:
I've also observed a clear disparity in the time taken by the first invocation of `x.cuda()` on Linux x64 with pytorch 0.1.12 and python 2.7.11 on a Titan X (Pascal); I've confirmed that I have the cu80 version of the conda package installed:

```
conda search pytorch -c soumith|egrep "0.1.12.*py27_2.*cuda80"
                  *  0.1.12               py27_2cu80  soumith         [cuda80]
```
For 0.1.12, the first invocation takes about 10 seconds for a 100x100 FloatTensor, while for 0.1.10, the first invocation takes about 2 seconds for the same.
